thread.title: QBE Insurance posts strong lift in interim profit but warns on mixed outlook
thread.title_full: QBE Insurance posts strong lift in interim profit but warns on mixed outlook

author: Mitchell Neems
title: QBE Insurance posts strong lift in interim profit but warns on mixed outlook
text:
QBE Insurance has posted a strong lift in first-half profit but delivered a mixed outlook for shareholders.
The insurer, one of Australia’s biggest, has cut its target for the amount of insurance premiums it collects from customers.
For the six months to June, the group’s net profit has clocked in at $US488 million ($662 million) — a 24 per cent increase on the previous year's $US392 million.
The insurer said the result was affected by the sale of its Argentine workers’ compensation business in February and a number of impacts related to the sale of non-core Australian and US agencies in the period.
It had also been affected by the pending sale of the Mortgage & Lender Services business in North America, the company said.
Last month, QBE said it would sell its North American Mortgage & Lender Services business to National General Holdings for about $US90 million.
Revenue in the first half was down 6 per cent at $US7.928 billion.
The company will pay a fully franked interim dividend of 20c on October 2 to shareholders on the register at August 28.
The insurer said its board has increased the maximum dividend payout ratio to 65 per cent of cash profits, up from the current maximum of 50 per cent, starting with the 2016 interim dividend.
However, QBE has adjusted its target for gross written premium and net earned premium for this year in light of changes in exchange rates and the disposal of the M&LS business.
“This has resulted in a reduction in our gross written premium target range and a similar reduction in our net earned premium target range,” management said.
QBE now expects a full-year net earned premium of $US12.3 billion to $US12.7 billion, down from a previous range of $US12.6 billion to $US13 billion.
QBE (Frame content direct link: http://markets.theaustralian.com.au/embed/QBE/640 .)
Originally published as QBE profit up, but outlook mixed
